comments.text: Plenty of vehicles going to Casablanca and Rabat so best to have a sign for your destination. Not much space to pull over but doesn't seem to be a big issue.

Juste avant un péage, idéal pour aller à Casablanca. Pour arriver ici, le L38 depuis Bab Doukkala m’a coûté 7 dirhams. Il fallait juste traverser le rond-point et tendre le pouce, presque immédiatement on m’a amené à Casa
Right before the peage is a great spot for going towards Casablanca. How are you going to get there, though if you're not as lucky as me?
Plenty of holidayers heading out to see the gorges. Didn’t take long for a lovely German couple to give me a lift to Dades
Very good spot near a gas station, payed 10mad for a petit taxi to get me there from tabount, you can wait under a tree in shade
Good spot with good place to stop the car, after 10 min stop Italians for me, no sign, afternoon
Use the highway, not the national road. We were picked up by guy from Agadir and we were smoking hash with him all the way. In agadir we were so baked that we spend the day at the beach.
Right next roundabout. Hard gravel shoulder. You can choose previous exit to Agadir by national road but this one is much faster.

3 minutes, you read it well
Empty grand taxi hoing back to Tanger took me all the way there for free
Just say "no money"
It's a pretty long walk from the medina to this spot, but here you are sure any car is going out of town and north, got picked almost instantly by two nice men who took us to see Pont de Dieu.

Not a lot of traffic. But a lot of nice people. First part we were in a trunk of pick-up than we changed to car who spoke English. (Cars have to stop sometimes in the valley because the road is being reconstructed because of the earthquake 2023), and this guy then took us to hotel of his friend, so much better price

Guy with local bus took us aerly at the morning. We were riding on the roof with local workers. They are rebilding this whole road through the mountains. It was super slow but beautiful. If you want to go fast to the south use highway.
Cars, not that fast going uphill and just right amount of traffic. Perfect spot for going Atlas. We got picked up by young group who stopped for us to take pictures twice at the view spots.
Good spot to go in direction of asni
First car stoped
Picked up by an Ambulance off duty. With a sign in Arabic and French
Not much shade here on a sunny day but got a quick ride from some nice guys to the next town over early morning.
I met some fellow travellers that proposed to me to get me to Casablanca. I wasn't even planning to go here but I agreed. Just start conversations if.
Police officers at the checkpoint helped me to get a lift
Good spot to get towards Agadir

Good spot if you going north 
It took me 5 min to find a car going directly to Tetouan
Local with porsche drove us to city center, However, I don't reccomend to go there, because then only taxi or other people who wants money stop.
After while an old scottish couple with caravan took us close to marrakesh, they stopped at markets twice to show us how to buy stuff cheaply, It was really good ride for beginning
First car took us to city center

Lots of place for a car to pull up. Judging from my previous experience and knowledge now my short wait was just luck. Abdul, a desert camp owner from Merzouga. He was registered to take tourists. We still got pulled over and asked for registrations three times adding an hour to our drive. Managed to just get my lift before sun set and Abdul let me stay at his desert camp. Book with Morocco Tours Now!!
Lotsa tourists on their way to the next tourist spot. Plenty of space for you to be seen and a car to pull over. Was going to Fes so definitely needed a sign for a big hitchhiking distance
Incredible spot if you’re staying in Imsouane. All the holidayers are heading to either Essaouira or Taghazout
One ride agadir to casablanca , took a cheap taxi to the spot, totaly worth it
Good Spot to get out of Fez towards west.
Perfect to go to Meknes
Grat spot. Local surfer picked us. His english was perfect. But watch out for turist scams through all the coast.
Excelent spot, just a sign that says "Marrakech" and we have our ride in less than 15 min

Good spot to go to Tanger. Unfortunately I had to pay for ride but that's mostly because I was to tired to fight for free ride after spending night under a bridge and before that escaping guy who wanted to have a gay sex with me but if you have energy to try to get a free ride this spot is definitely good (Aldo I've marked that I used thumb I actually used Arabic form of it which is pointing at the road with my forefinger)
We got a ride in the back of the scooter with the trailer, was fun! We were offered some tea and pastries before we headed further from Marrakesh.

Waited here for 6 min
Someone from Belgium took me all the way to Marrakech
Good spot, easy to find cars to the south.
Good spot, but not a lot traffic. You have to be lucky, to find someone to the bigger street, that leeds south or north.

very only way to go to imlil 
a couple of tourists pickups us 
they were supposed to stop the village just before but they let us directly to imlil

Super Spot pour descendre vers bouarfa petit à petit 
Très important de se mettre au maximum à l’abris des regards de la police afin d’éviter tout problème aux locaux et à vous bien sûr

I have hitchhiked from here 3 times and have never waited longer than 5 minutes(even with multiple people).
Hitchhiking is so engrained in the culture here that it's almost weird to even contemplate taking a bus somewhere. My only advice is always announce that you don't want to pay before getting in as sometimes they will try and pretend they are a taxi service 💅
Vers good Spot, Lots of Cars, Low wating time
Local, no sign, afternoon
After 5 min French tourist stop for me
Best spot goin south. Probably doesnt matter where you stand as long as theres space to stop and its not in a turn.
Obvious, but thats your spot if youre going to chaouen
Waited 2 minutes for a ride to Tetouan. Ideal Spot.
took 20minutes from here to tetouan. We got here by a nice driver that took us from chefchaoen
Not surprisingly, it's super easy to pull over. That's where we caught one of the coolest rides we ever had in Morocco. (March 2024)
At 7:30 am, there are a lot of workers hitchhiking towards Hassilabied/Merzouga. At that time, catching a ride is a matter of literally a few minutes, or even seconds. (March 2024)
Good place to hitchhike towards tinghir
Good place to stop, we catch a bus to ifran that agreed to take us for free
A lot of place to stop, the best is to stand on the top of the hill
One of good spots to get out of Rabat toward Fez
Good place to get to Essouira. We got to a orange truck and drove with nice slow speed to see all the beautiful landscape on the way. Very humble and kind humans. As Moroccoans in general.
I've never caught a car that quickly! To Ouarzazate, no sign, Saturday 9am
It was the fourth passing car, no sign, Friday 9am.
Friday around 11am
Scored a ride to the border with trucker. No payment expected. Long wait, quite a few rejections
Ask a local to write destanation sign in arabic. You will be picked up very fast.
You get a ride quite easily here. Lot of shared taxis driving as well. You can ride with them, ask for a free ride or wait until a regular car arrives.
I litterally showed my thumb and the first truck stopped to pick me up. Direction Rabat / Casablanca. Perfect
From the highway stoped on the side took 3 people right to Marrakech
There's an ibis hotel that many cars turn into, as well as a bus stop that most of the locals stand around at. If you go up the road past the hotel turnoff, there's trees for shade.
Perfect place to Marrakesh direction.
To get this place use the bus number 59 from the Place des Nations Unies.  Bus stop called "Marjane Technopark".

I stood on the petrol station side for a while, there’s ample stopping space but people may have assumed I was going south. While not as visible and harder to stop on I got lucky and hailed a truck the moment I moved to the east side of the road
no problemo for fes
Easy to Casablanca
As soon as i got here it was relatively easy catchin a ride to casa. Heavy traffic (afternoon)
We have just finished our cartboard to Casablanca and instantly Marrocan man said that he can give us a lift to Casa
Picked up by local tour guide heading to Imlil. Thumb and sign in Arabic
Ask local people in Asni to write a sign of your destination in Arabic. You'll be picked up bij a car within a few minutes
Good place going to Imlil, had some problems with police on the way there though, they thought the driver was an illegal taxi driver because of us.
Lots of nice local interaction, however finally got a lift with Italian tourists driving to Zagora. Not many cars on the road. A sign in Arabic helps with translations.

A good spot to pull over. We hitchhiked here twice (in March 2024 and February 2023), and in both instances, we waited for about 45 minutes. The waiting time heavily depends on the time of day. It's one of the places in the desert region of Morocco where we waited the longest for a ride. Nevertheless, we had some of the most memorable hitchhiking experiences here in Morocco (with a film producer heading to a Netflix film set in the middle of nowhere and with a super lovely Moroccan couple headin

Many competitors and I've waited here the longest in my entire trip. Trucks usually go to the mine and wouldn't pick you up. Eventually a really nice guy picked me up and the ride to Zagora is very scenic where we stopped to enjoy the view and he invited me to his home twice to eat together!

Saturday 11am, no sign.
Asked people at the gas station and found a ride to Marrakech within 15min
Asked maybe less than 4 times. Found a young fun group of 3 who took me to Safi. They made me in love with life.
There is a petrol station so there are many people who go to Marrakesh from here
Learn some Darija. I thought this car full of lovely ladies said 12km. Much better to hitch here than from 2km up the road
it is easy to find a good long ride here,
Good spot but a lot of local cars too.

It took a while but it worked well, its a good spot because there is a car selling coffee so cars and trucks stop, I put 4 stars because was quite windy and the sand is kind off like desert to its a bit painful in the eyes
Very good spot nice area to stop the car, big traffic a lot of drivers smiling and waving to us
Nice spot, we catch a bus which took us to errachidia for free
Nice scenic route with lots of cars going to errachidia
There is lot of people that are geting taxi. Ewen when we used thumb (in morroco thumb means hitch-hiking and the index finger means taxi) the guy we stoped wanted 10 dirhams.

Good place if you want to go to Essaouria or other places alongside Atlantic coast..
I waited only 15-30min for ride to Essaouria and there where also few local guys waiting..
go hundered meters AFTER the taxi stop, worked a lot better there. I think people assumed we wanted a taxi
Just after the police checkpoint and roundabout in direction Fes. Not too much traffic, but with a sign took me only 15 minutes to get a direct lift.
Everything perfect here

Location is perfect. You can supply yourself and cars are passing by slowly. Expect other morrocean hitchhikers.

Best hitchhike ever ! 2 sec of wataing, AC Bus, kind people and free food ;)
You can get here with the Bus N°22. There's a big Supermarket. Get off there. After the Roundabout people pass slowly so it's easy to hitchhike. There's even a gas station.
Hitchhiked to Moulay Idriss and Volubilis, swift ride
alternative road to get fes (very close) u can visit also countryside and holy places like moulay idriss
Juste après le péage. 5 minutes pour aller à Tanger Med, mais je pense que c’est encore plus facile si tu vas à l’ouest

A toll booth that takes you to the highway A4. There is not too much traffic but if you just keep walking towards the highway on-ramp someone stops for sure because there are no local \\"hitchhikers\\" and a foreigner here sticks out like a sore thumb.
Not much traffic but space to stop. Probably the best to go south from here
Good place to stay, easy to go in south, car can stop 🌸

Took me over an hour to get picked up here on a weekend. I walked down the street for quite a while after here, trying to hitchhike whenever a car came (not so often). Finally someone took me to the roundabout down the road from where it was no problem to get to Fes.

Right around here is the official end of Chefchaouen. There's room to pull over, but traffic isn't too high so they can just stop on the road. The 2nd vehicle picked me up, couple of Germans.

You could probably hitch much earlier before this spot :)
local hitchhiker spot, go here!
Place is very good to stop, but because many local people also use hitchhiking as a taxi there's hard to get a ride for free, and cars usually go to next village. In the end we took a bus to midelt

Almost no traffic south. If youre coming from the north and try to go south (direction meknes) and you have the option of a ride into quezzane its probably better to take it and hitch outta there again then standing here. Still lucky after an hour

Lot of traveler go in this way, people go slowly with the roundabout. 
And lot of people go to meknes and Fez. 🌸 Big place to parc the car. 
We slept in a tente we ask with farmer if it’s possible to put the tent. Better if you speak little bit Arabic 😅

Locals are friendly :)
But it feels a little silly to hitchhike sometimes, because the bus to Essaouira is so very cheap from here... A matter of pennies.
I hitched from here to Sidi Kauki many times, usually waiting 10-20 minutes. People have all been very very nice.
I was wary of the speed of traffic further up the road. Not a many cars here but they’re still heading Tangier way. A kid came by and wagged his finger to help me hail a car, it worked. Thanks mate
Most traffic is heading out of town here. Decent enough space to stop
My favourite hitch yet, a donut truck going all the way to Fes. Didn’t see many tourists out this way. Long stretch for vehicles to see you and stop
We catched the truck that took us through whole mountains all the way to the Oulad Berhil. We were riding on the truck bed. It is beautyful road.
Couple of guys picked us and took us to  Imlil. We had sign in latin and arabic.

There are some hitchhikers normally waiting behind the border and. Most of them are organising with the truckers somehow. It's definitely not easy there but you are visible to everyone and with some luck you'll catch some tourists who are going far. (French campers rarely take strangers haha)
Not perfect, because not a lot of cars going south, but it worked at the end.
Found a car in 10 minutes and luckily he was working close to the Tanger med and we could get there to catch a ferry. Tried to hitchhike a ferry but didn't succeed in the end
Work pickup truck
Good spot to Agadir. I really recommend to stay in tangzhout it is beatiful city 30 minutes before Agadir. Bus for approxi 10 MAD to Agadir from tanghzhout
10mins and a kind guy took us to tanger med. he even made a detour for us. I think we were lucky though, because the cars are already quite fast.
Good place to hitchhike towards merzouga
Good place for hitchhike towards merzouga
At the end of the line, directly on the motorway, the cars are going fast, but they see you from long distance
No competitors, low traffic for long distance rides. Monday 5pm, without sign.
Good spot to go to Fès by the national road or the highway. Accessible by taxi (it's the the limit that red taxis cannot exceed before exiting the city).
Station de service/aire de repos assez fréquentée. Y’a aussi un rond-point à 5 minutes à pied au cas où
Good place to hitchhike but we might have been lucky since there isnt a lot of cars here
Maybe I was not lucky!!! Also I was with dust around and under the sun, I got a bus, just 2.5 euros  to Chefchaouen...
Lot of local people to wait. Trucks can ask for money.
Not too many traffic, but had to wait only 15 minutes with a sign Chefchaouen
not so many cars but you will prevail :)

Yep!!! Very Good Spot to get Hitching directly into CHEFCHAOUEN!!! but be careful from white taxi! if u want free ride be little bit patience and wait about 3o Min!! But for good to not lose time just walk forward nad stick ur thumb.

Im the one who wrote the previous comment. Edit: we had no luck at total, actually I think this spot might be better to fes because some people take the highway from there. I give 5 stars to neutralize my previous rating, but you will need a sign there because not many cars stop at the station
There is a way better spot „total“ about 1km towards Fes. We had no luck there because there were almost only motorbikes stopping, so we decided to relocate to Total with a taxi for 20drh.

you walk out of the city, then you find a petrol station, you can speak with the drivers their, but they want normaly money, dont pay more then 100 diram to Fes. Otherwise take a plate like me, with FES on it, I dont need more then 20 min.
